Select-Statements

This article contains the rules for select statements:

  1. All select statements that returns more than one row, must contain an ORDER BY
  2. Select statements must be formatted as shown in the following example:
SELECT
  FirstName
, LastName
FROM UserName
WHERE 1 = 1
ORDER BY FirstName
  1. All rows must be written in a single line
  2. The ,-separater must be placed in the next/last line
  3. FROM, WHERE, ... must be written in a single line
  4. If a column exists in more than one table, an explicit alias must be used:
SELECT
  -- Use the explicit alias UserId, 
  u.Id as UserId
, g.GroupName
FROM User u
JOIN User_Group ug on ug.UserId = u.Id
JOIN Group g on ug.GroupId = g.Id
  1. Joins must be written explicit, do not just join using auto-joins over foreign-keys
